result.execSummary:
The defendant Donnell T Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Donnell T Johnson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Donnell T Johnson was found guilty of 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $2,750.00 payable to Konta S.  Joint and several with codefendants Jonathan Portillo 15CF2144 and Derrell Taylor 15CF2145.

Provide a DNA sample.
Pay all of the following by the end of supervision.   Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment: restitution ; all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA; all applicable fees of supervision.
All court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
No alcohol or drugs.
No possession, consumption, selling, distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
No contact with Konta S.

Follow all rules of supervision.
Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment.  Cooperate with any programs deemed necesary by the probation department. Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; also advised that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donnell T Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Received and Filed:
Notice of right to seek post conviction relief
Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement

Defendant Donnell T Johnson in court with attorney Peter J. Kovac.  Defendant Donnell T Johnson in custody.  Daniel Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  8 YEARS with zero days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and/or the WI Substance Abuse program.  
Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- No contact with: Konta S.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $2,750 payable to Konta S., JOINT AND SEVERAL with co-defendants Jonathan Portillo (15CF2144) and Derrell Taylor (15CF2145); 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Certification of transcript of Scheduling Sentencing Hearing proceedings commencing June 30, 2016 received and filed. (10 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Peter J Kovac, 1551 N. Prospect Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53203.
Branch 22 will accept this case for global resolution on 08/10/2016 at 1:30pm if the defense can provide a transcript of the victims statement.

Defendant Donnell T Johnson in court with attorney Peter J. Kovac.  Defendant Donnell T Johnson in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also present in Court: victim K.S.  Court holds conference with counsel in chambers off the record.  Matter was scheduled for sentencing hearing at 1:30pm, matter called at 4:05pm.  Court was unable to call case earlier, Court was conducting jury trial.  Court is unable to complete sentencing hearing today.  Court holds colloquy with victim, victim wishes to make statement today.  Court hears statement of victim, K.S.  Court orders sentencing hearing adjourned.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.
- dated 6/26/16 from defendant, filed.

Defendant Donnell T Johnson in court with attorney Peter J. Kovac.  Defendant Donnell T Johnson in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is scheduled for jury trial today.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 2 as charged.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders COUNT 1 DISMISSED.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.   Plea questionnaire, addendum, plea agreement and jury instruction received and filed.   Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court orders defendant REMANDED pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 30, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Donnell T Johnson in court with attorney Peter J. Kovac.  Defendant Donnell T Johnson in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is scheduled for SPEEDY jury trial today (Expires: 5/23/16).  Court holds conference with counsel in chambers off the record, matter is called on the record.  Defense is requesting an adjournment, Court places status on the record.  Court will be proceeding to trial in another matter.  For reasons as stated on the record,  Court adjourns this matter to 5/3/16 at 8:30am in Br. 35.  Jury trial scheduled for May 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Notice of Potential Alibi received and file with court.

Defendant Donnell T Johnson in court with attorney Peter J. Kovac.  Defendant Donnell T Johnson in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requesting the Defendant appearance waived for the testimony of the first witness Konta S. Defendant does not contest the request. Colloquy between the Court and Defendant on the record. With the agreement of the Defendant Court will grant the request of the non appearance of the Defendant for the testimony only on the first witness Konta S.  Motion Hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the Defense:  1).  Konta S. (without the presence of the Defendant).  Side bar.  Cross-Examination.  Defense rest.  Defendant now present in court.  Discussions held.  Sworn for the State:  1).  Officer, Kurt Ziarnik  (MPD).  Exhibit 1 Supplemental Photo Array (PC24) marked, offered, and received into evidence. Cross-Examination. Redirect.  State rest.  Testimony closed.  Closing arguments made.  Court denied the motion. Case adjourned for a Jury Trial on 05-02-2016 at 09:30 in Branch 35.
Mr. Johnson's Notice of Intent to Use Learned Treatise as Evidence, filed,

Defendant Donnell T Johnson in court with attorney Peter J. Kovac.  Defendant Donnell T Johnson in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is scheduled for jury trial today.  Court holds conference with counsel in chambers off the record.  Matter is called on the record.  Defense is challenging identification.  Court hears offer of proof from defense, Court hears additional argument.  Court finds notice of alibi was not filed timely.  Court places findings abd status of the case on the record.  Court passes case.  Matter continues on the record.  Defendant waives speedy trial demand.  Defense motion to adjourn trial argued and granted by the Court.  Defense reasserts speedy trial demand (Expires 5/23/16).  Motion hearing scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Mr. Johnson's motion to supress identification, filed.

Defendant Donnell T Johnson in court with attorney Peter J. Kovac.  Defendant Donnell T Johnson in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is scheduled for final pretrial conference and motion hearing today.  Court holds conference with counsel in chambers off the record, matter continues on the record.  Court to address identification motion on the day of trial.  Matter remains in trial posture, matter remains scheduled for SPEEDY jury trial on 2/22/16 at 9:30 am in br. 35.

Defendant Donnell T Johnson in court with attorney Peter J. Kovac.  Defendant Donnell T Johnson in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter has been joined with #15CF2144 and is scheduled for jury trial on 2/1/16.  Court holds conference with counsel in chambers off the record, matter is called on the record.  Defense counsels motion to adjourn trial argued and GRANTED by the Court.  Defense filed speedy trial demand (Expires: 2/11/16).  Defendant requests to EXTEND SPEEDY TRIAL RIGHTS until next available trial date of 2/22/16, Court approves request.  Court orders 2/1/16 jury trial date VAVCATED.  Defense to file additional motions, to be heard on final pretrial date.  Motion hearing scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 09:30 am.
State's Witness List, filed.

Attorney Peter J. Kovac in court, defendant Donnell T Johnson not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court is currently in trial and unable to conduct final pretrial conference today.  Matter remains in trial posture, matter remains scheduled for jury trial on 2/1/16 at 9:30am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Donnell T Johnson in court with attorney Peter J. Kovac.  Defendant Donnell T Johnson in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is in Court on State's motion for joinder with #15CF2144 and pending drug matters and Attorney Kovac's motion for severance.  Court holds conference with counsel in chambers off the record.  Matter is called on the record.  Court hears argument.  Court DENIES State's motion for joinder re: pending drug cases.  Court DENIES Attorney Kovac's motion for severance.  If defense wishes to pursue supression motion, counsel to file motion (to be heard on final pretrial date).  Matter remains in trial posture.  Matter remains scheduled for SPEEDY trial on 2/1/16 at 9:30am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Motion to Suppress Identification.

Attorney Peter J. Kovac in court, defendant Donnell T Johnson not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense argument to reduce bail argued and DENIED by the Court.  Counsel filed SPEEDY trial demand on 11/13/15, matter scheduled for motion and jury trial. 

Motion hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 1, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Peter J. Kovac in court, defendant Donnell T Johnson not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. BRANCH 22 FOR BRANCH 35. Demand for speedy trial withdrawn. Case remains calendered for motion hearing on November 20, 2015 at 8:30 a.m. in Branch 35.

Defendant Donnell T Johnson in court with attorney Marcella De Peters and attorney Peter Kovac.  Defendant Donnell T Johnson in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Marcella De Peters in court, defendant Donnell T Johnson not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Case adjourned for final pretrial on 8.10.15 and for jury trial on 9.8.15.   All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 08-10-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Donnell T Johnson in court with attorney Marcella De Peters.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 7.  Status conference scheduled for 06-29-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Donnell T Johnson in court with attorney Marcella De Peters.  Defendant Donnell T Johnson in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Defense Counsel requests sequestration of all State's witnesses.  Sworn for the state:Andrew Farina-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Co-Defendants Jonathan Portillo and Derrell Taylor or Rayford J.; Ricardo F. dob 4/28/79; Ricardo F. dob 6/14/57; Konta S.; Anthony B.; Demelius R.; Alan R. Maridza M. or Kyla F.

Defendant Donnell T Johnson in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Donnell T Johnson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
